transportAdvice: Agra's main tourist sites are spread out and not easily walkable between them, so auto-rickshaws, cycle-rickshaws, and taxis are the primary ways to get around; a limited local bus network exists but is not well-suited for tourists. Metered and negotiated taxis are widely available near major attractions and hotels.

weather.description: Cool and pleasant winter days with chilly nights, making it one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Mild and dry with warming temperatures, still very pleasant for sightseeing.
Temperatures rise noticeably and conditions remain dry, though midday heat begins to build.
Hot and dry with intense afternoon sun; early morning visits to monuments are strongly advised.
Extremely hot and harsh conditions with scorching daytime temperatures that can be challenging for outdoor sightseeing.
Pre-monsoon heat gives way to occasional heavy showers, with high humidity making conditions feel oppressive.
Peak monsoon month with frequent heavy rainfall, high humidity, and possible flooding around low-lying areas.
Monsoon continues with persistent rain and muggy conditions, though the Taj Mahal in mist can be atmospheric.
Rains begin to ease but humidity remains high and occasional downpours are still common.
Post-monsoon cooling brings pleasant days and lower humidity, marking the start of the tourist high season.
Comfortable and dry with clear skies, ideal conditions for visiting the Taj Mahal and other monuments.
Cool winter weather with cold nights and mild days; fog can occasionally reduce visibility in the mornings.
